type.name: section
type.title: Function of Dental Council.  PART III DENTAL PRACTITIONERS
type.context: DENTAL REGISTRATION ACT under Function of Dental Council.  PART III DENTAL PRACTITIONERS  4.  It shall be the function of the Council  (a)  to undertake responsibility for the registration of dental practitioners, dentist extenders and dental technicians;  (b)   to  advise  the  Minister  where necessary  on matters relating to  (i)      dental  services in Guyana and to the performance of those services by dental practitioners, dentist extenders and dental technicians;  (ii)     the establishment of a suitable training programme for persons to perform the services of dentist extenders and dental technicians for the maintenance of a good standard for those services. (1) A person who applies to the Council to be registered as a dental practitioner and who satisfies the Council that he    (a)   is  a citizen of Guyana, or is a national of a Member State, the spouse of a citizen of Guyana or is resident in Guyana;  (b)  can communicate satisfactorily in English;  (c)       is of good character;  (d)   holds   a   diploma,   degree   or  certificate  obtained  by examination  after  attending  a  recognised  dental  school approved by the Council;  (e)       is qualified to practice independently  in the country where he obtained his diploma, degree or certificate,  shall, upon submission of a sworn declaration in Form 2 in the Second Schedule together with the particulars mentioned in subsection (2), and on  payment of the prescribed fee, be entitled, with approval of the Council, to be registered as a dental practitioner and thereupon be issued with a certificate of registration in Form 3 in the Second Schedule. (3) The  Council  may  require  any  person  who  applies  for registration as a dental practitioner under this Act, and who does not, in accordance with the criteria of the Council whether prescribed or not, fulfil the requirements of subsection (1) (b), (d) or (e) to submit to such examination as the Council thinks necessary. type.title: Services dentist extenders may perform.
type.context: DENTAL REGISTRATION ACT under Services dentist extenders may perform. 21. A dentist extender may, in addition to such dental services, as may be prescribed, perform on a child who has not attained eighteen years the following services provided such treatment is undertaken in health  establishments  operated  by  the  government  and  under  the supervision of a registered government dental practitioner  (a)   extraction  of  teeth, including preparation and after  care;   (b)       administration of local anaesthetic;  (c)    fillings  not  involving  exposure  of  dental  pulp  and preparation for such fillings;  (d)      scaling, cleaning and polishing teeth;  (e)    topical application of anticariogenic agents to teeth;  (f)      exposure and processing of dental X-ray films;  (g)   teaching and giving advice on oral hygiene and mouth care.

type.name: section
type.title: Appeals.
type.context: DENTAL REGISTRATION ACT under Appeals. 30. (1) Subject to subsection (4) any person who is aggrieved by the refusal of the Council to register him under this Act, except Part IV, or by its decision to censure him or suspend his registration or cause his name to be removed from the register may within three months after the receipt by him of any such notice, appeal to a Judge in Chambers.  (2) The Council may, pending an appeal under subsection (1) of any person aggrieved by its decision to suspend his registration or cause his name to be removed from the register, on the application of that person   suspend   the   operation   of   any   such   decision   until   the determination of the appeal. type.name: section
type.title: Possession or control of dental appliances or supplies.
type.context: DENTAL REGISTRATION ACT under Possession or control of dental appliances or supplies. 34.(1) Subject to subsection (3), a person who, for the purposes of practising dentistry or performing dental services, has in his possession or control dental appliances or supplies is guilty of an offence and liable on summary conviction to a fine of one hundred thousand dollars and to imprisonment for up to five years.  (2) For the purposes of subsection (1), possession or control of dental appliances or supplies by a person is prima facie evidence that the possession or control is for the purpose of practising dentistry or performing  dental  services  by that  person  in contravention  of  this section.  (3) Subsection (1) does not apply to the possession or control of dental appliances or supplies by  (a)     a person registered under this Act;  (b)     a person dealing in dental appliances or supplies; or  (c)      a  person  permitted  by  the  Council  to  have such possession or control.
